title: Harry Reid: 3 Obama confirmations coming
content:
Reid says he hopes the deal will lay the groundwork for more cooperation in the Senate . Reid : 3 Obama confirmations coming
The Senate is on track to approve three more of President Barack Obama ’ s nominees this week , Majority Leader Harry Reid said Wednesday .
Reid hopes to approve Fred Hochberg to head the Export-Import Bank , Gina McCarthy to head the Environmental Protection Agency and Tom Perez to lead the Labor Department by the close of business Thursday . A leadership aide said Hochberg will most likely be confirmed Wednesday , with final approval on McCarthy and Perez coming as early as Thursday , depending on how much time Republicans want to debate the nominations . The Senate often breaks for the weekend on Thursday afternoons , making it likely the three nominations are dispensed with before Friday dawns .
The movement on the long-stalled nominations follows the approval of Richard Cordray to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Tuesday . Agreements to vote on these nominees — as well as three candidates to join the National Labor Relations Board — come as the result of a Tuesday deal between Reid and Republicans to avert an unprecedented Senate rules change .
Reid had threatened to change the rules of the Senate to move those nominations forward in the face of Republican filibusters but was able to avert the “ nuclear option ” of a rules change on votes on executive nominees that would have lowered the voting threshold on some of Obama ’ s picks from 60 to 51 . Instead , senators agreed to fill the NLRB and allow Hochberg , McCarthy , Perez and Cordray to go forward without a change to the Senate rules .
Reid hopes the agreement has laid the groundwork for more cooperation in the Senate .
“ We have now started a new era , I hope a new normal in the Senate where senators talk to each other rather than past each other , ” Reid said Wednesday .
content_original:
Reid says he hopes the deal will lay the groundwork for more cooperation in the Senate. Reid: 3 Obama confirmations coming

The Senate is on track to approve three more of President Barack Obama’s nominees this week, Majority Leader Harry Reid said Wednesday.

Reid hopes to approve Fred Hochberg to head the Export-Import Bank, Gina McCarthy to head the Environmental Protection Agency and Tom Perez to lead the Labor Department by the close of business Thursday. A leadership aide said Hochberg will most likely be confirmed Wednesday, with final approval on McCarthy and Perez coming as early as Thursday, depending on how much time Republicans want to debate the nominations. The Senate often breaks for the weekend on Thursday afternoons, making it likely the three nominations are dispensed with before Friday dawns.

Story Continued Below

The movement on the long-stalled nominations follows the approval of Richard Cordray to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Tuesday. Agreements to vote on these nominees — as well as three candidates to join the National Labor Relations Board — come as the result of a Tuesday deal between Reid and Republicans to avert an unprecedented Senate rules change.

( Also on POLITICO: Richard Cordray vote leaves GOP at a loss)

Reid had threatened to change the rules of the Senate to move those nominations forward in the face of Republican filibusters but was able to avert the “nuclear option” of a rules change on votes on executive nominees that would have lowered the voting threshold on some of Obama’s picks from 60 to 51. Instead, senators agreed to fill the NLRB and allow Hochberg, McCarthy, Perez and Cordray to go forward without a change to the Senate rules.

Reid hopes the agreement has laid the groundwork for more cooperation in the Senate.

“We have now started a new era, I hope a new normal in the Senate where senators talk to each other rather than past each other,” Reid said Wednesday.
